en: I will cry unto God with my voice, Even unto God with my voice; and he will give ear unto me.
hmr: Ka râwlin Pathien chu ko ka ta, Ka râwlin Pathien ngei chu ko ka ta, ama chun keia tieng na lo sit a tih.

en: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord: My hand was stretched out in the night, and slacked not; My soul refused to be comforted.
hmr: Ka lunginzing ni chun LALPA ka zawng a; Ka kut hi zâna khawm la thla loin ka phar zing a, Ka hringna hin thlamuon a nuom nawh.

en: I remember God, and am disquieted: I complain, and my spirit is overwhelmed. [Selah
hmr: Pathien ka hriet zing a, ka buoi hlak; Ka ngaituoh a, ka thlarau hi a châu hlak.

en: Thou holdest mine eyes watching: I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
hmr: Ka mithai hi i chel meng zing hlak a, Ṭawng theilo khawp rauvin ka lunginzing hlak.

en: I have considered the days of old, The years of ancient times.
hmr: Tienlai nihai ka ngaituoh a, Tienlai kumhai chu.

en: I call to remembrance my song in the night: I commune with mine own heart; And my spirit maketh diligent search.
hmr: Zâna ka hla sak chu ka hriet thar nâwk a, Ka lungrilah kân ngaituo hlak; Ka thlarau khawmin ṭhahnem- ngaitakin a zawng a.

en: Will the Lord cast off for ever? And will he be favorable no more?
hmr: LALPA chun kumkhuoin a thlauthlâk ding am a ni aw? Iengtika khawm a lâwm naw ding am a ni aw?

en: Is his lovingkindness clean gone for ever? Doth his promise fail for evermore?
hmr: A ngilneina chu a bo sawng kumkhuo ding am a ni aw? A thutiem chu suon po po chenin a bo ding am a ni aw?

en: Hath God forgotten to be gracious? Hath he in anger shut up his tender mercies? [Selah
hmr: Pathien chun lunginsiet a theinghil am a ni aw? Lungsenin a lainatnahai chu a khâr ta am a ni aw?

en: And I said, This is my infirmity; But I will remember the years of the right hand of the Most High.
hmr: Chun, “Chu chu ka hrât nawna lei a nih; Nisienlakhawm, Achunghnung- tak kut changtieng kumhai kha hre zing ka tih.

en: I will make mention of the deeds of Jehovah; For I will remember thy wonders of old.
hmr: LALPA thilthaw thuhai kha hril ka ta, Tienlaia i thilmak thawhai kha hre zing ka tih.

en: I will meditate also upon all thy work, And muse on thy doings.
hmr: I sinthaw po po kha ngaituo bawk ka ta, I thilthawhai khawm kha sût ka tih,” ka tih a.

en: Thy way, O God, is in the sanctuary: Who is a great god like unto God?
hmr: Aw Pathien, i lampui chu hmun inthiengah a um a, Pathien ang hi pathien ropui tu am an um a?

en: Thou art the God that doest wonders: Thou hast made known thy strength among the peoples.
hmr: Nang chu thilmak thaw hlaktu Pathien chu i na, Mi tin laiahai chun i hrâtzie în hriettir hlak.

en: Thou hast with thine arm redeemed thy people, The sons of Jacob and Joseph. [Selah
hmr: I bânin i mihai i sansuok a, Jakob le Josef nauhai chu.

en: The waters saw thee, O God; The waters saw thee, they were afraid: The depths also trembled.
hmr: Aw Pathien, tuihai chun an hmu cheh a, Tuihai chun an hmu cheh a, an ṭih a, Tui inthûktakhai chu an inthin bawk a.

en: The clouds poured out water; The skies sent out a sound: Thine arrows also went abroad.
hmr: Sûmhai khin tui an bun- thlâk a, Vânhai khin râwl an insuo a, I thalhai khawm ân lep zak zak a,

en: The voice of thy thunder was in the whirlwind; The lightnings lightened the world: The earth trembled and shook.
hmr: I vâninrûm ri chu thlivirah a um a, Kâwlinlephai chun khawvêl hi a el zawt zawt a; Hnuoi hi inthinin ân hnîng dur dur a.

en: Thy way was in the sea, And thy paths in the great waters, And thy footsteps were not known.
hmr: I lampui chu tuisuorietah a um a, I lampuihai chu tui lientakah a um a; I kehnunghai khawm hriet a ni nawh.

en: Thou leddest thy people like a flock, By the hand of Moses and Aaron.
hmr: Mosie le Aron kutin, I mihai chu berâm ruol angin i ṭhuoi hlak.
